definition: sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]

sentences.english: And all Israel bewailed him with great lamentation: and they mourned for him many days.
sentences.chinese: 全以色列都举哀痛吊他，哀哭多日。

sentences.english: And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.
sentences.chinese: 乌利亚的妻听见丈夫乌利亚死了，就为他哀哭。

sentences.english: They shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.
sentences.chinese: 他们必为美好的田地，和多结果的葡萄树，捶胸哀哭。

sentences.english: On that day, Confucius would weep and do not sing.
sentences.chinese: 孔子在这天为吊丧哀哭过，就不唱歌。

sentences.english: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
sentences.chinese: 他所遗留的人必死而埋葬，他的寡妇也不哀哭。

sentences.english: But your relatives, all the house of Israel, may mourn for those the Lord has destroyed by fire.
sentences.chinese: 只要你们的弟兄以色列全家为耶和华所发的火哀哭。

sentences.english: And that will transform both the tears and the weeper.
sentences.chinese: 由此才使得泪水和哀哭者一同得到转变。

sentences.english: One woman walked out as the two officials entered.
sentences.chinese: 两位工作人员进去时，一位哀哭的妇女走了出来。

sentences.english: All Israel will mourn for him and bury him.
sentences.chinese: 以色列众人必为他哀哭，将他葬埋。

sentences.english: And Joseph fell upon his father's face， and wept upon him， and kissed him.
sentences.chinese: 约瑟伏在他父亲的面上哀哭，与他亲嘴。

definition: to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
